result.execSummary:
The defendant Darnelle M Polk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Darnelle M Polk was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Darnelle M Polk is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Darnelle M Polk was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay $25 per month commencing 1/2/2016 for court costs. Failure to pay may result in a commitment of -1- day for every $25 owed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darnelle M Polk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on commitment order
Transcript: Preliminary Hearing    3/23/2015     Terri Knowles
Transcript: Status on Jury Trial    9/22/2015     Terri Knowles
Transcript: Adjournment of Trial   9/29/2015   Terri Knowles
Transcript: Final Status before Trial    11/25/2015   Terri Knowles
Transcript: Jury Trial    11/30/2016    Terri Knowles
Debt has been certified to WI DOR tax intercept program.
Jury question  (2)
Not guilty of Ct. 3 - Guilty of Ct. 4
Stipulation and Order for Return/Destruction of Exhibits
11/30/2015 & 12/1/2015 Trial     Exhibit 1 - DVD (located in CD/DVD Exhibit binder)    Exhibits 4 thru 10 located on SH 4-3 in Exhibit Room

Atty. Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Johnny Pinder appears in person and by Atty. Matthew Weil. Defendant Darnelle Polk appears in person and by Atty. Matt Last. Defendant Johnny Pinder examined by Court and notified he can wear street clothes in lieu of jail uniform. Mr. Pinder does states he wishes to proceed in jail uniform.

  9:07 am  36 jurors reported and given oath.
  9:08 am  22 jurors called to jury box.
  9:12 am  Voir dire by court.
  9:44 am  Voir dire by Atty. Gerol.
  9:58 am  Voir dire by Atty. Last.
10:05 am  Voir dire by Atty. Weil.
10:10 am  Court/jurors recess.
10:20 am  Court in session. Atty. Weil continues voir dire.
10:25 am  Striking of jury by counsel.
11:14 am  Opening statement by Atty. Last.
11:18 am  Opening statement by Atty. Weil.
11:22 am  W.M. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Last, Atty. Weil,redirect by Atty. Gerol, exam by Court.
11:35 am  A.G. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, no crossexam by Atty. Last, crossexam by Atty. Weil. 
11:47 am  J.S. sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol. 
11:54 am  Court/jury lunch recess until 1:00 pm 
  1:10 pm  Court/jury in session. Atty. Gerol plays video on Exhibit #1.
  1:15 pm  Det. C. Polishinski sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Last, crossexam by Atty. Weil, redirect.
  1:45 pm  Officer R. Glejf sworn and tetified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Last, crossexam by Atty. Weil, redirect, recross by Atty. Last.
  2:05 pm  Officer S. Moertl sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Last, crossexam by Atty. Weil.
  2:15 pm  Sgt. M. Kasten sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol.
  2:20 pm  Officer B. Vashholtz sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam by Atty. Weil. 
  2:28 pm  Court/jury recess. 
  2:55 pm  Court is informed State will rest. Court examines defendant as to their right to testify. 
  2:58 pm  Atty. Last motion for directed verdict. Atty. Weil motion for directed verdict. Court amends the information to reflect burglary of an  "office" in lieu of building or dwelling. 
                  Court denies motion. 
  3:08 pm  State rests/Defense rests. Jury excused.
  3:10 pm  Court held jury instruction/verdict conference.
  3:42 pm  Closing statement by Atty. Gerol. 
  3:52 pm  Closing statement by Atty. Last.
  4:02 pm  Closing statement by Atty. Weil.
  4:08 pm  Closing statement by Atty. Gerol.
  4:14 pm   Court instructs jury.
  4:40 pm   Bailiff sworn.
  4:42 pm   Jury leaves for deliberation.
  4:55 pm   Court received a question from jury.
  5:06 pm   Court/counsel/defendants in court. Court will provide the following exhibits to the jury: 1A, 1B, 2, 3 & 10
  6:15 pm   Court/counsel/defendants in court. Court notifies counsel as to jury question. 
  6:24 pm   Jury present in Court. Court statement to jury to continue deliberation. 
  6:25 pm   Jury returns for deliberation.
  7:45 pm   Court/counsel/defendants in court. Discussion as to how to proceed.
  7:47 pm   Court is informed jury has reached a verdict.
  7:48 pm   Court/counsel/defendant/jury in court. Verdict read: As to Johnny Pinder Ct. 1- Guilty  Ct. 2- Guilty /  As to Darnelle Polk Ct. 3-Not Guilty  Ct. 4-Guilty
  7:49 pm   Jury polled.
  7:50 pm   Jury thanked and excused. Court revokes Johnny Pinder's bail and remands him custody. Atty. Weil is not requesting. 
Court orders Darnelle Polk sentenced to 30 days jail with credit for time served. Court orders Mr. Polk submit DNA sample and pay court costs with payment plan of $25 per mo comm 1/2/2016.

Defendant Darnelle M Polk in court with attorney Andrew Rider, appearing for Atty. Matt Last.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel stated they are prepared for trial on 11/30/2015.
Jury status hearing at 11-25-2015 09:30 am
Due to a calendar conflict, time of jury status changed from 8:45 am to 9:30 am on 11/25/2015.

Defendant Darnelle M Polk in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Last motion for bail modification. State opposes motion. Court denies motion to reduce bail.
Motion hearing at 10-23-2015 08:30 am
Jury trial at 11-30-2015 08:45 am

Defendant Darnelle M Polk in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reschedules motion hearing on 15CF84 & trial date on this case and co-defendant 15CF854.
Counsel notified case will be rescheduled for jury trial from 9/29/2015, another case is proceeding to trial. Counsel to appear on 9/29 to reschedule.

Defendant Johnny K. Pinder in court with attorney Matthew E. Weil.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Last states he is prepared for trial on 9/29/2015 and objects to adjournment. Atty. Weil request to adjourn trial, defendant Mr. Pinder is now at Racine Correctional, he needs additional time to review discovery with defendant. Atty. Weil further states there is a possible consolidation of Mr. Pinder's case. Defendant Pinder states he does not object to adjournment of trial. Atty. Gerol requests cases be tried together. Court will keep both these cases on for trial on 9/29. Defendant Polk enters speedy trial demand. Mr. Pinder to remain in Ozaukee County so Atty. Weil may review case. Motion to suppress will be heard the morning of trial.

Judge Williams presiding in absence of Judge Malloy. Defendant Darnelle M Polk in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed defendant is withdrawing his request for speedy trial and severance of cases. Court examines defendant and accepts his withdrawal of requests.  Atty. Tanz motion for bail reduction. State opposes motion. Court amends bail to $6000 cash w/same conditions previously imposed.

Defendant Darnelle M Polk in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of information, enters not guilty plea subject to jurisdictional objections.  Further proceedings scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Arraignment on April 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Darnelle M Polk in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Det. Corey Polishinski sworn and testified. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. Arraignment adjourned to 4/28/2015. Atty. Alme Boaz moves to withdraw as he has a conflict on this case. Court grants motion, public defender to appoint new counsel for defendant.

Defendant Darnelle M Polk with attorney Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Defendant in custody and appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of the penalties.  State requesting $15,000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $7500 cash bail w/conditions:  no contact with property at 1025 West Glen Oaks or with A.G. or J.S.  Counsel requesting preliminary hearing; not waiving timelimits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
